text: RC4 é * A proprietary stream cipher owned by RSA emc * Ron Rivest design, simple but effective * It can have variable key size (from 1 to 256 bytes) * Byte-oriented operations * Itis widely used (web SSL/TLS, WEP, WPA) * Key forms random permutation of all 8-bit values; permutation used to scramble input info processed one byte at a time * Secure against known attacks - have some analyses, none practical — Note: WEP is broken not because of RC4 but for the key handling process
